Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; part of elaborate lotus-palmette in added white and added red; exterior: band of short diagonal strokes at rim above two dilute lines; below, maeander band and frieze of dots separated by dilute lines; in field below part of pendant triangle as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by McLean Museum and Art Gallery, Greenock. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
There is a large blue circular mark on the exterior surface of the sherd where the object was once glued for display.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1606) (phase 2)
